bundlesegmentation package¶

Submodules¶

bundlesegmentation.BundleSegmentation module¶

bundlesegmentation.BundleSegmentation.bundle_segmentation(source_dir: str, subject_list: list, ses_list: list)¶

Performs bundle segmentation using tractseg. DWI images are first registered to MNI152 space using a FA map. Tractseg segments into 72 bundles, using a U-net architecture All 72 bundles are registered back to subject DWI space using inverse transform

Parameters:

  • source_dir (str) – source directory of the DICOM

  • subject_list (list[str]) – list of subjects

  • ses_list (list[int]) – list of sessions

bundlesegmentation.BundleSegmentationParameters module¶

bundlesegmentation.MergeBundles module¶

bundlesegmentation.MergeBundles.GetBest(bundle_dir, output_path, ROIS=[])¶
bundlesegmentation.MergeBundles.create_equivalence_table(bundle_dir: str)¶

Create an equivalence table between bundle id and bundle name

Parameters:

bundle_dir (str) – directory where are located Tractseg outputs

bundlesegmentation.MergeBundles.create_intersection_image(bundle_dir: str, mask_paths: str, output_path: str)¶

Create a 72 channels image for each 72 segmented masks by tractseg

Parameters:

  • bundle_dir (str) – directory where are located Tractseg outputs

  • mask_path (str) – children directory of bundle_dir

  • output_path (str) – path for writing the stacked image

bundlesegmentation.MergeBundles.gen_sphere(x0: int, y0: int, z0: int, radius: int)¶

Generate a sphere of center (x0,y0,z0) and radii radius. In a np array of size 145,174,145

Parameters:

  • x0 (int) – x coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • y0 (int) – y coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • z0 (int) – z coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • radius (int) – radius of the sphere

bundlesegmentation.MergeBundles.get_masked_infos(stack, sphere_mask, x0: int, y0: int, z0: int, radius: int)¶

Mask the 72 mask image into the sphere mask space

Parameters:

  • stack (numpy array) – stacked image

  • sphere_mask (numpy array) – mask of the sphere in the dimension of the original image

  • x0 (int) – x coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • y0 (int) – y coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • z0 (int) – z coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • radius (int) – radius of the sphere

bundlesegmentation.MergeBundles.main_merge_bundles(bundle_dir: str, output_path: str, x0: int, y0: int, z0: int, radius: int)¶

Main function to generate a sphere mask for a given center (x0,y0,z0) and radii (radius), mask the bundles created by tractseg with the sphere mask. And access the proportion of each bundle in the sphere.

Parameters:

  • bundle_dir (str) – directory where are located Tractseg outputs

  • output_path (str) – path for writing outputs

  • x0 (int) – x coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • y0 (int) – y coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • z0 (int) – z coordinate for the center of the sphere

  • radius (int) – radius of the sphere

Module contents¶

Package featuring programs for white matter bundle segmentation from anatomical and diffusion MRI data. Using Tractseg

pytracto
